author: FMagl

text:
Yes, it is a homage to NES/SNES era RPG games and the game makes numerous references to classic games.

Highly reccomend you get it, it's cheap, $3 and comes with Cthulhu Saves the World
author: heavymetalmonster13

text:
Just seeing the titel makes me want to wonder ''Did these guys take the name from CAPCOMs Breath Of Fire? one of my most beloved franschises EVER!''???

Nice song btw. I like it.
author: TheCommentGuy8

text: @xSayPleasex Crazy how that happens, if it's unintentional. Robo's Theme from Chrono Trigger is Never Gonna Give You Up was also supposedly incidental. I wonder if it's just a repression of a heard song, then it popping up in the composer's mind without recognizing that it was from somewhere OR perhaps different musicians genuinely come up with the same melody. Calculus was discovered by both Einstein and Leibniz, so who knows. Maybe there's some math to this art.

text: of all the vgm (and especially from 16bit rpgs) i listened, this is one of the finest. it somehow manages to sound sad and gloomy but happy and joyful at the same time. it makes u feel u are on an adventure, exploring new lands... like in good ol times ~sigh~

author: JayPay

text: I bought the Zeybod pack on Steam which contains this game and Cthulhu Saves the World, for a dollar or two during the sale. I finished this game today, it took me about 4 hours. It's a short old school RPG with some great humorous dialog and some surprisingly interesting gameplay mechanisms. The graphics look like Dragon Warrior on the NESï»¿ with some great synth music. I'm going to start Cthulhu next.
